website_summaries.verdict: Although the Epson WorkForce takes its time printing snapshot photos and graphics-heavy documents, this office-capable device earns my approval with affordable inks and cloud-printing features.
pros: The Epson WorkForce 645's intuitive control panel, compact footprint, and cloud-printing versatility strengthen this all-in-one's workplace utility
cons: This all-in-one falls behind its competition with moderate photo print quality and output speed

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer used and it does not print correctly. The printer nozzles are stopped up or something. I have cleaned them several times and put in new ink 3 times and it still does not print correctly. I am very diappointed with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cason

customer_reviews.title: Works great...then the ink problems creep up on you.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great as long as you bought the $60+ Epson ink. We don't print but only occasionally so even the Epson inks would dry out. After about 3 years with this printer, it became impossible to get the ink heads to act properly. I also made the mistake of trying to save money on ink cartridges. The printer warned me about a voided warranty if I used these non-Epson inks. Sure enough, it won't print anything now. I bought Epson inks (cha-ching) and they don't even work now. I switched back to HP. Got a HP OfficeJet 4650 and so far I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Big piece of worthless trash
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of worthless trash I have ever purchased. It is good really only for the first round of ink and then it goes precipitously downhill from there. Adding insult to injury you cannot use it for scanning to a memory card if you don't have full ink which basically forces you to spend more money on an operation that is not linked to printing. I will NEVER recommend an EPSON printer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: California Kid

customer_reviews.title: Expensive experience!
customer_reviews.text: Ran out of ink and I can't use scan or fax until I replace the ink cartridges. Called customer service and they said I would need to buy ink before I can use the other functions. I've bought Epson ink 2 times before and replaced before it ran out. The unit works well but the issues I've had with wi-fi and the expense of ink makes for a poor experience. I wouldn't recommend it. I was quick to get connected with Epson customer service. But the the Epson customer service rep seemed beat down and despondent when talking with them about the issue. All they did was read from the script when I brought up the issue.
customer_reviews.author: 10ant

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy an Epson Printer!!
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT like this printer. I just had to buy all new cartridges for it because it said they were all low. It is still acting and printing the same way......... It Will Not Print !!! The print is very, very pale. It won't print in color and when printing in black it looks like the black cartridge is so faded you can't read anything on the paper. I am so disappointed in this printer. I can't get any help with this printer from Epson and now I read comments on other Epson Printers and they are saying the same thing. I thought HP was bad but I will say that Epson Products are worse.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Limited Paper Handling
customer_reviews.text: For the first several years, my printing/scanning needs were more business-oriented and the standard letters size (8-1/2 x 11) was fine. I've been doing more graphic design work for a non-profit and I suddenly find myself with very limited options. First, no paper larger than standard letter size. There is no manual feed tray to be able to use legal size paper. Because of the paper path, the printer can only handle a lighter weight card stock. If there was a manual feed tray with a straight paper path, you would be able to print on a quality heavy stock.
customer_reviews.author: Fog City Frank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent makes me happy!
customer_reviews.text: The Epson Workforce 645 4-in-1 has proved to be a smart investment for my little office. It's quick to print and makes top-notch copies. The scanner is a little slow, but that's no problem with me. After a document is scanned, you have four options of distribution, one of which is to apply the copy directly to an email. What a time-saver! Set-up was extremely easy for me (I'm not technologically-advanced). I've not tried the fax option yet. The printer is somewhat loud. I've gotten used to it, but it still interrupts my cat's sleeping pattern :) My research paid off on this printer purchase. I am very happy with the Epson Workforce 645; it has fulfilled my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Trail Gal

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for nearly a year now. Cons: 1. Ink 1/5 - the unit only allows you to print a certain number of pages with each cartridge. Has nothing to do with how much ink might actually be remaining 2. Configuration 2/5: I never could get the wireless feature for the scanner working, and only got the wireless working for the printer when security was disabled. 3. Paper Jamming 3/5: Happens more often than it should 4. Automated Document Feeder (ADF) 3/5: Reliability only so-so. Pros 1. Design 5/5 2. Print Quality 5/5 - Good enough for my home office use I'll think twice before buying another Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Ghent

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding home printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has met all my expectations. Beautiful print quality, printing to the edges of the page, 2-sided printing, fast printing, decent ink economy, easy cartridge replacement -- I have been very pleased with this purchase! The only con I've encountered is the paper tray, which is sometimes fussy and needs a little care to insert or remove. But that's a very minor complaint, and it doesn't detract at all from the excellent quality of this unit. We've printed a few thousand pages, including cardstock, vellum, transparencies, and labels, and the printer has not jammed once. I would recommend this to friends and family without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDopp

customer_reviews.title: Great School/Office Printer, Not So Great Photo Printing/Scanner
customer_reviews.text: The printer is incredibly fast and quite efficient. It is definitely a must have for college/home-office work. The quick-load scanning tray is very handy when trying to multi-task, plus it usually gets the documents scanned pretty straight. Ink on the printer is not very expensive and lasts a very long time if you opt for Extra HC cartridges. I would not count on high quality scanning or photo printing, which is the only reason this receives a 4/5. I feel like the scanning quality could have been a little bit better, and I did expect the photo quality to be bad.
customer_reviews.author: AdamMB91

customer_reviews.title: All in one is all you need!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer, I love the automatic document feed with duplex scanning even more. This printer duplexes (prints on both sides), scans on a flatbed or via a document feeder (which can automatically scan both sides), can scan directly to a flash drive or memory card. Also, it is wireless so you can use it as long as your computer is on the same Wifi as the printer. The only draw back is that it prints somewhat slowly, this is not a drawback to me since I don't frequently print 100+ pages on a deadline, but if you do it may be a consideration. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: JM in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Tired of the jams and poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as a printer and scanner for about 3 years. I have now come to regret this purchase. It jams way too frequently, about once every 10-15 jobs. Furthermore, the print quality is terrible. There are usually horizontal lines and "banding" going through the print outs. This occurs even after doing a nozzle cleaning. Also, the thing is terribly noisy and causes my desk to shake and vibrate while it is printing. Even after it has finished printing, it continues to make churning and squealing noises. I will now be researching an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: "I'm so glad we bought this - how did we live without ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for about 3 years, and I can't count the times I've said, "I'm so glad we bought this - how did we live without it". We don't print a lot, primarily school stuff and the occasional work item. But the ability to print, scan, and photocopy has saved so many late evening trips to town. The print quality is fine. I selected this printer partly because of the ability to print 2-sided, which it does without hassle. I have yet to have it jam. The scan quality is plenty good enough for my need. It's not lightning fast, but certainly adequate for household use.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - Perfect for our Needs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer for home and home office duty. While all of the multi features are nice, we wanted the WIFI option the most. In looking at all of the printers available on Amazon at the time, this was the best value with the best reviews. Setup was simple and we had the printer talking with three MACs and two PCs within 15 minutes time. The WIFI setup was done via the front panel by selecting the WIFI network and entering the password; same process used for most WIFI enable devices. In short, we like this print and expect it to last for a few years. Printing is fast and crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Fastest Inkjet Printer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fast inkjet printer with duplexing and WiFi. This unit delivered all of that, plus copy, scan, and fax functionality. It easily scans documents and photos in PDF or JPEG to a local SD memory card, which can be used in any PC or Mac computer to retrieve the file(s) for further manipulation. Copying multi-page documents with the Auto-Document Feeder (ADF) is a breeze. Also, I'm happy to report that you can use aftermarket ink with this Epson printer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Sideleau

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because the HP I had before (with identical features) was a piece of garbage I regret ever spending money on. Epson is a trusty brand (plus, I used to have Epson scanner way back in the day, and loved it!). The printer is good quality and pretty much performs as it is supposed to most of the time. The only gripe I have about it is that the feeder constantly jams paper to the point of me not using it any more. It is simply not worth it to have my original doc ruined in the jam. Other than that, it's a good, dependable product.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: money pit
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst scam ever. Printer worked great for first 6 months. You will be replacing ink non-stop after that. If you need to print in black only and the magenta is out, good luck you will have to buy all new cartridges and replace the pink to print in black (even if you chose black and white option on the print settings). The absolute worst and most frustrating printer I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea1234

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, water-proof ink, but some banding.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: The waterproof ink was wonderful. I could highlight printed documents without smearing them. Usually I wouldn't dare do such things unless it was a laser-printed document. Easy to set up. Con: Banding when I printed the document. The default print setting seems to be really light, almost like a draft print. I had to increase the quality of my prints almost immediately. I think this might mean that the # of pages they quote for their ink tanks might be misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After going through ink issues with my HP All In One printer/scanner/copier that was only 4 years old, I tossed it in the garbage and bought this one here. I love it, it is nice looking, easy to set up, and does a FANTASTIC job. I was afraid I might have some problems hooking up because I have all Apple products, but it could not have been any easier. I can print from all my Apple devices now! my iPhone, iPad and iMac !!! YAY!!!! and it automatically does double sides which saves paper. YAY! could not be happier. Perfect for home/office use. As far as I'm concerned, HP can kiss my arss.
customer_reviews.author: Mab7

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this printer... lasted me 8 YEARS.
customer_reviews.text: Great print quality. User friendly and sturdy machine. Sadly, I bought cheap ink and ruined the heads and further destroyed by 'repairing' it myself. Bought a new Epson model and returning now to buy another 645.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Still surprised with this printer!
customer_reviews.text: I really did not expect to like this printer as much as I do. Printers are just printers, right? Wrong. AirPrint. Google Cloud Print. Email address for printing remotely. Nice! Quality of the prints are pretty good, not something I would want to print out high quality photos with but for everything else it's very nice! The cost of ink is always a sore spot, I use my laser to print out all my B&W stuff to mitigate that. This was a super buy at the price I got it for (less than $100), I give it my full recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Epson makes the worst printers ever and ink cost will kill you
customer_reviews.text: Epson makes the worst printers ever and ink cost will kill you. The first time I used it, paper jam and getting it out caused printer head to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: j wayne

customer_reviews.title: Epson makes the best printers.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Epson printers now. The 545 and 645. I do not know why anyone would buy anything else. The ink cartridges last a long time. The printer is fast, the document feeder works fine, I am old and I do not have any trouble reading the interface screen. The fax machine works. I just converted to a wireless network, just a push of a button, and it works just as good as the wired connection did. I think my favorite thing is the paper trays They hold a lot of paper.
customer_reviews.author: JacksCrafts

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ALL In One!
customer_reviews.text: I'm upgrading from another Epson so I can have all in one wireless. I've been very satisfied with this purchase and all the new bells and whistles I get to use on this Workforce machine. Prints great (vivid color). Doesn't make a lot of noise. Still have not scanned or faxed yet, but set up was easy and printing from my laptop and Iphone is great. I realize that faxing is limited to receiving only, but I did know this prior from reading the product guide on the Epson website. For the value and price that I paid, I am satisfied with my new Epson thus far.
customer_reviews.author: ALA

customer_reviews.title: Best I've had. Workhorse. Good $$.
customer_reviews.text: For this price this printer is great. Its a workhorse, it prints fast and efficiently. The paper tray is so uncomplicated you just dump the paper in there and go. I have never had a paper jam. Wireless feature is great and easy setup, five minutes tops. I don't print photos so I cannot give a rating there. The best part about this printer is that you can get the ink here on Amazon for a ridiculously low price. Other printers will bleed you dry with their cartridge prices. Plug it in, setup the wireless data and your done. Scanner/copier great too.
customer_reviews.author: buyer1111

customer_reviews.title: Good but big
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews, price range and options. I've had it about a week now and I really like, but one thing I would warn others is that it's pretty big. It's definitely larger than a shoe box, and is probably the biggest piece of equipment I have in my house. Once you get past how large it is, I think you'll like it. So far so good. I love the WiFi option and also that I can send an e-mail to the printer from any place and it will print for me - ready to go when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Workforce workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Though I have only had the printer a short time it is performing up to expectations. It works very well on my wireless network. One warning, if you are using an older computer with limited memory the software will drag down the performance of your system. I recommend downloading the specific drivers that you need from the Epson website. If you use the disk it loads everything with no option to be more selective. Totally killed my laptop's performance until I uninstalled it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Workforce is a workhorse
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through plenty of all in one printers and I can easily say this is the best we've ever gotten (with as always keeping cost in mind). It does use ink cartridges and will consume them regularly if you do a moderate amount of printing and we can only imagine printing photos. All in all, it lives up to its name and is a Workforce! Five stars are easy to rate from the point of view of not only myself, but my wife as well. It seems complicated at first but surprises you by being very user friendly. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Top feeder jams
customer_reviews.text: I heard so much about this unit, but in reality i am disappointed. To set up to scan to email you need a USB connection which makes no sense because in my case i am using wired to the router(ethernet cable) as well as wireless for the apple airprint devices(this feature works very nicely). Double sided printing is good and fast. Areas of disatisfaction: 1) Jams whenever i scan a document using the feeder. 2) Needs a USB cable in order to use the scan to email feature My hp is a lot easier to setup and use.
customer_reviews.author: Everyday is an Adventure

customer_reviews.title: Don't ever run out of ink!
customer_reviews.text: You know... I've had pretty good luck with this device. However, I'm now out of magenta ink, and the f*n thing won't print from my bookkeeping program. I've set the default to B&W, but that doesn't make any difference. I keep getting the restrictive notice that I need to buy f*n magenta ink before I'm allowed to print in B&W. Can you hear me now, Epson? This will be my LAST product that has your name on it!
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever bought for myself
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I ever bought for myself. I've had this for years and I've never had problems with it. I've used it for school, work, and personal reasons. I've even moved at least five times since I bought it and it's as good as when I first bought it. I'm considering naming it, like when you name a car, because it's so reliable...
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Works great on home wireless setup.
customer_reviews.text: I love having a color printer with 4 ink cartridges, and it has been a great money saver over the old Canon with all 3 colors in one cartridge. Plus, the cartridges are large and last longer even though they cost less. One weakness is the fast/econ print setting because the print quality is below other fast setting I have used on other printers. That said, the standard quality is good and printing is fast. I would buy this again if I needed another printer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCloskey

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using my new printer/copier. I homeschool my 3 kids so this machine will get a lot of use. My kids laugh at me when I am excited that I can print and copy on both sides of the paper with just a push of a button. I no longer have to figure out which way to put the paper back in to copy/print on the backside. It also has a feeding tray for my originals so I don't have to remove each sheet one by one to lay the next. Its a headache/time saver!! I highly recommend this machine. My only complaint (which is why there are only 4 stars) is that its very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: royallycrazy

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! My old HP Deskjet lasted many years, but started to go on the fritz and just didn't offer all the features I want now, so I did my homework and bought this printer. It scans incredibly well, does double-sided printing, and has been easy on using ink as far as I can tell. I was able to hook it up to my home network quickly and now the whole household can print to it. It's fast, but a little loud (but that doesn't bother me). Has worked flawlessly for me over the last few months and I cannot recommend it enough for a home office.
customer_reviews.author: Jim (Science/Tech/Parent)

customer_reviews.title: Feature-rich, consistent quality!
customer_reviews.text: This feature-rich all-in-one provides consistent, high-quality printing (fast for text; very good photos), speedy scanning using the automatic document feeder (ADF) and excellent high quality scans on the flatbed. The memory card reader which supports SD cards (and others) is great for saving scanned files on the go without being connected to a computer; the SD card can also be read as a "server drive" via the WiFi! Faxes received can also be saved directly to the SD card for later retrieval. Google CloudPrint enabled. Extremely intuitive user interface and very easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Brian I. Rizowy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended to me
customer_reviews.text: My daughter who is far more experienced with the computer world recommended this printer to me when my HP took a dive. I have been impressed with it's functionality and speed. If it works as well as hers it would be worth twice the price I paid for it. I was willing to pay $200.00 plus but found it for $114 which included shipping. Hopefully things will work out for me as well as it has my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: not a value
customer_reviews.text: The price seemed right when it was bought but within weeks the competition introduce similar products for about 20% less money. The advertised lower cost of printing was never realized. Only cheaper aftermarket ink allows this machine to be used at all. The paper tray is difficult to insert. The 645 failed and was eventually replaced under warranty after I jumped through enough hoops to satisfy Epson. Epson will be boycotted for a while.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Epson workforce 645
customer_reviews.text: Producet arrived , out of the box and setup in about an hour. No issues with wireless setup ( I have an Asus router - very good product) . Functions and performs as expected for a 130-140 dollar printer (you pay for what you get). I got this model because of the wireless print capabilites with my Ipad. Downloaded the iprint app and printed a photo just like that, no issues fairly good quality. You do have to know what your doing... can't be a complete dullard, follow the directions which are fairly easy to understand and execute.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: Just got this printer, set it up and tested all the functions I will use. I followed recommendations of previous buyers to download software from Epson site rather than using the CD. Driver installation was very easy and didn't take long at all. This was the easiest device I've ever connected to my wireless network. Wireless printing works great, scanning and copying were no problems. Couldn't figure out how to wireless scan with the automatic document feeder for two sided or multiple page scanning, not sure if it isn't possible or I'm not doing something right. Very nice upgrade for my seven year old HP all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: Granite

customer_reviews.title: So far, I like it
customer_reviews.text: So far, this printer has been a lot less expensive to run than my previous one. That is the main reason I got it. It prints quite well, but I noticed that now it is skipping a hairline, which is not noticeable on text but you can see it on graphics. I do not print pictures. It is quite more noisy than my previous printer, but the difference in initial cost (and ink cost) makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Printer fixed itself
customer_reviews.text: I've had good luck with this printer. It uses a fraction of the ink of my former Kodak printer. I've only had one problem: when I moved it to the floor and then put it back on the desk, it started printer white streaks in black only. On-line, I found out that the printer is sensitive to tilting and that I needed to run the printer's self diagnostic to clean the printer head. It's hardwired to the printer, so I didn't need to download software to run the diagnostic. I did - it cleaned the head - and it worked fine afterwards. I was really glad it fixed itself. Otherwise, it's worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cragin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and securely packaged. There was no assembly required. I was able to plug it in, download the drivers and start printing right away. It is quiet efficient, fast, and prints photographs with great clarity. It is compact in consideration of all its features, and convenient to store in a remote location. I can print something and retrieve it whenever I need it. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Lee

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much -- I bought another!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product at a great price. Setup was easy with both WiFi and USB arrangement. Print and scan quality are excellent. Comes with ABBYY PrintReader OCR; best OCR software I've ever used. This software alone was worth the price. It took dirty documents in both Spanish and English and did great text recognition. Fax function is much better than our dedication fax machine. Threw the old fax machine away. I liked this machine so much that I bought a second one for my secretary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, but check prices elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I really love this printer. I upgraded to it from a very ancient one, and this works like a dream. Scanning took me a while to figure out, but that is my one complaint about it so far. I've now had it for about 2 months. I was quite annoyed though to find the exact same printer at Walmart a week after I bought this one, for about $40 less... Do some price shopping before you take the plunge!
customer_reviews.author: Keary Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Way to go
customer_reviews.text: Having chose this printer I am very content with the start time and the life of the ink. I print a lot of color photos and this Epson is certainly one of the best I've come across for low cost ink and running time. The quality of the prints are exceptional and the copying is perfect. have not bothered with the fax utility or the wireless, but even without these, it is a wonderful printer copier for a very low price.
customer_reviews.author: David Edwards and Tina Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one !
customer_reviews.text: I love this Epson Multi. Much more durable than the 3 other HP's I've had. I just wish the Ink Combo didn't cost as much as the Printer ! Epson is not alone in this rip off. I think they are all in the Ink business and sell you the Printing Equipment to lock you in. Anyway, it's been a great product and I would buy it again if I had to do over.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. MCDOWELL

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing through Amazon is always a great experience. Prices are reasonable and shipping is quick. The printer itself is easy to set up if you do it through the provided software. The claimed speed isn't realized under normal use, I'm sure it can be achieved under optimal conditions, but it is fast enough for me. The print quality is very good and the extra features like the smartphone application make it handy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: and it still produces great color and text documents
customer_reviews.text: This effing printer! I still use it regularly, and it still produces great color and text documents. I love that it works with Windows, Mac OS X and Linux for both printing and scanning, and while I rarely use it, the Fax portion also works great (even color if the other fax machine you're talking to also does color). I don't give many products 5 stars, but this one definitely gets one for just how damn useful it's been.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cagle

customer_reviews.title: Cost Effective and Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this little printer/fax/scanner. We use it for all of the above, and to print copies of the many photos of our new baby boy. Top quality on all functions - easy to install and use - and very cost effective in terms of price of unit and price of ink. Ink lasts much longer in this printer than it did in our previous Lexmark. GREAT for a home office or college student!
customer_reviews.author: Clarice Rogers

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had the printer only a few months now, but so far I like it. The printing is clear and I like the idea of replacing only the color cartridge I I need instead of the entire 4 color cartridge I needed to replace with my HP printer (which I had no problems with, honestly) But I think the printing is clear and quick. Setting up was easy with my desktop computer and USB cables, however I still have not been too successful with setting it up on my laptop using the wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Kurek

customer_reviews.title: Sweet! iPhone and wireless printing
customer_reviews.text: The only issue with this printer is that in order to scan multiple pages it must be connected via USB. I did also have issue with Epson software not being able to find the printer on a machine. Luckily, I'm good with software and networks and fixed the issue Prints fast. I love being able to print for any pc or Mac in the house. Ink is sorta expensive, but I guess all ink is
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I only got this to work a couple times with my Wi-fi and then it stopped working. Even if I plugged it in with the cord it didn't work. I called the company multiple times to try to get it working and they couldn't figure anything out. It was very frustrating. I finally just got rid of it. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Baking delight

customer_reviews.title: SImple, inexpensive, rock solid..........
customer_reviews.text: I've used Epson and Brother exclusively over the last 8 years of owning my business. HP and Lexmark are crap as far as the units I've tried. My latest Brother DCP-7065DN has been unimpressive so I tried the Epson 645. WOW! Simple, well designed, easy to use, great scanner.... I use non-epson ink with no issues.............Thanks Epson, great product.
customer_reviews.author: ATDM

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am really, really happy with this printer. It does everything but vacuum the rugs. I find it so easy to use and it is surprisingly quiet. I have had problems with other printers in the past, but this Epson is a quality purchase. It also takes up less desk space than my other printers have. The quality of the printing is very professional and there are so many features on it.
customer_reviews.author: McPenguin5

customer_reviews.title: Better than any printer I bought so far
customer_reviews.text: I had it for over a year by now and used it to print occasionally, I haven't run out of ink so far and the quality of printing is great and fast. I used it a lot to scan documents and has done a great job for me. Prior to that I had epson workforce 310 that consumed a lot of ink and decided to git rid of it. It was a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boulos

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForce 645 4-in-1 Printer
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get rid of my old HP 4-in-1 as the print heads & ink were costing me a fortune. I reviewed several brands of printers on Amazon and found this one to have a high rating for all features and the cost of ink. And, Amazon offered a great discount. So far it is operating flawlessly. I would recommend this nicely designed unit to anyone needing a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Blum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Canon Printer via the amazon web site. It was very easy to set up on my MAC and works well with it and two PCs on my network. Printing (especially 2 sided),scanning, and copying all work very well. I have not used the Fax. I set up the printer on my network via the control panel. However, I suggest using the Installation disk that comes with the printer as it will install the utilities.
customer_reviews.author: Stu707

customer_reviews.title: GREAT bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Wireless printing is GREAT! Double sided printing is what evolution is about! Good Looks to boot! No Fuss set-up! PRINT, SCAN, FAX (even two sided!) $110 with ink NO BRAINER Cons: cheap plastic parts, small black ink cartridge, can't print on a DVD 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Erik G

customer_reviews.title: Epson  Workforce 645
customer_reviews.text: After using Canon products for many years I switched to the Workforce 645 based on the reviews I read here at Amazon. So far I have been very pleased with this product. It was easy to set up, and has performed flawlessly. The automatic feeder has worked fine, as well as the faxing, scanning and copy functions. Print quality and printing speed are excellent. My daughter has a Canon printer and prefers to use the Epson for her printing needs. I have not really done much photo printing but so far the quality has been very good on the few I have done. So far no negatives with respect to this printer.
customer_reviews.author: sc

customer_reviews.title: A bargain
customer_reviews.text: We bought this all in one to replace a Brother MFC. Unlike the Brother this doesn't eat up ink even if you don't print much. It is a real all in one with fax capabilities unlike some which are called all in one but don't have fax. The wireless feature works well and so far its performance is flawless. I would have given it 5 stars but it is kind of large which is no big deal really considering the other features.
customer_reviews.author: Art Mensch

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked well. Stopped working after 15 months with paper jam error and no paper jam. Used the troubleshooting guide and also called Epson tech support and informed it was probably a hardware drive that malfunctioned but since my warrantee expired 3 months ago, I could take it somewhere to have it fixed. I will have to buy a new one and it will not be an Epson. Very disappointed since I did my research before purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Moore

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what i needed. I can print from my iphone if i didnt feel like printing from the computer. This is just a wonderful printer. You can scan, copy, fax. This is just like a work printer/ scanner only its better because its smaller and more convienent! And for the price it made it even better. Ive had the printer for about 5 months now and i still love it. In great working condiction so far!
customer_reviews.author: Breeana

customer_reviews.title: Epson Workforce 645 - Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Epson printer. I find this printer to be much easier to work with than my previous HPs like the HP 6500 for example. Faxing and scanning are without issues, unlike what I experienced with the HP 6500. The setup was easy and the printing is very good quality and fast. I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Big Hank @ ATL

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now, and still rally like it. The ink lasts forever! It does two-sided printing with ease, except if you're using card stock. My only problem that I've had with it is that for some reason my laptops recognize it as a printer, but not as a scanner. I'm not sure how to fix that.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Second Epson Printer that I have purchased & I am very happy with it. Has many features that my old Epson printer didn't have & at a cost of $99, I felt it was a great Value purchasing it on Amazon. I do not use Epson replacement cartridge's($13+), but purchase cartridges online at $6 which seem to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dstealth

customer_reviews.title: Started OK, but quickly sucked
customer_reviews.text: Printed ok for a bit, but then started putting lines in the print and had to keep cleaning the heads. I would not buy an epson again. Nor would I buy from ElectronicOOutlet (an amazon seller) again as they won't accept the return for either of these. (Bought two and both had the same issue.)
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Massive let down
customer_reviews.text: Had to print something in the last minute and this printer completely failed me. I only print in black and white and this printer decided that since im out of magenta it cant print my all important document in black and white (full black ink in cartrige).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love my printer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a while back. I had a smaller printer that was no longer working. I looked in store but none were on sale at the time. I got a good deal here. I have enjoyed my printer and the copy functions work great. Did not hook up the fax function. Prints pictures nicely as well.
customer_reviews.author: Denise K. White

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. Only one problem. The printer color when I got it had lines through it when printing photos. I kept cleaning the ink jets but never have been able to get go photo quality. I think i can get better quality if i work with it but just never have time. I have had it since 2012 and don't want to buy another one cause I love this one so much
customer_reviews.author: D L HANCOCK

customer_reviews.title: construction
customer_reviews.text: The product feels very flimsy. I found the paper feed tray to be "temperamental." It does not print as fast as the advertising had me expect. It was highly recommended by someone I always listen too, but so far not impressed. If it last for more than two years and does not use my life savings up in INK, I will re-write this review. So far, underwhelmed, but it is printing clearly in black and white. It also prints with my wi-fi from another room thorugh one log wall, so that is good.
customer_reviews.author: 2myself!

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Simple install, and works great on our Vista and Win 7. Everything is wireless through the router, no printer cables, only its power cord. Loving that! Prints quick, and crisp. Does have a lot of buttons, but if you use a business style copier, you got this with no problems. It's so compact and simple. Thanks Epson!
customer_reviews.author: FBW

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I never had a dependable printer until I got this one. They would always seem to be inoperable right when I had 5 minutes to get what I needed and leave (for class, errands, etc.). This one hasn't given me a single issue. I don't regret this purchase one bit.
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: this thing is perfect. I have had issues printing in color
customer_reviews.text: As a scanner, and a black and white printer, this thing is perfect. I have had issues printing in color, so I can't give it a full 5 stars. If you're not going to print in color, this will be perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great printer. Does everything we expect in a home ...
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Does everything we expect in a home printer. We use this for normal run of the mill printing and copying, scanning. Not a home office or anything. We have nothing bad to say at all. The ink usage isn't bad and replacement ink is affordable. We researched this ahead of buying this printer to find a unit that the ink didn't cost a fortune and this printer is true to its word. Great all around for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: unknown

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: The 645 meets our home office needs. The primary reason for this purchase was "Airprint" capability to use with an iPad and iPhone--it works perfect with them. The print quality is excellent, noise low and speed is fast. Built-in wireless is the only way to go. It works seamlessly with our new Apple N Router.
customer_reviews.author: Charlestoner

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Printer
customer_reviews.text: Don't get too exicted... They don't make this anymore. There is a new model now. This one should see me through the rest of my days though. It even makes pretty darn good photos too. Ink lasts long, and high resolution for pictures. Not professional, but good for family photos. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: JaxPlace

customer_reviews.title: The Best All-in-One
customer_reviews.text: the best work station I've had to date. I like being able to insert an SD card into the unit for quick and easy processing.
customer_reviews.author: MtnJoy

customer_reviews.title: Great fast printer; does everything.
customer_reviews.text: It is working great on off-brand cartridges, is super fast, and does a great job if you keep good black ink in it. I even got very decent color photo prints. I love the quick double sided printing. Wireless setup was a breeze. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This has been a realy work horse for us. I love the wireless, it works from any room in the house. I haven't had any issues with it. The only one draw back is the ink is pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner

customer_reviews.title: Set-up Bad. Printer Good
customer_reviews.text: The setup was not as easy as Epson would have you believe. Not that it was terribly complicated, the wireless did not want to work and even getting it setup through the USB cable required a call to the Epson Support people. Epson Support? Like everyone else these days it would seem to me that it is in a timezone on the other side of the globe but given enough time (lots of time) they will get you up and running. Having said all of that... It really seems to be a good product. Does everything it is supposed to do very well. I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: usahd32

customer_reviews.title: Great performing printer
customer_reviews.text: The Epson Printer is the best printer I have ever used. I have taught school for over thirty five years and I have been required to make lots of copies of materials for students to use. This machine has not let me down. It always prints clearly and efficiently time wise. Thank you for Epson printing machine. It is a dream come true.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Woolfork

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This lasted through 2 sets of ink. Now a paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Office Printer.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this printer to replace 5 year old "All in One" printer. Ease of set-up was amazing, Unwrap printer and plug-in, had my network recognize printer, load software and you are up and printing. Print quality is great, photo prints are awesome too, just be sure to use correct paper, really makes a difference. Ink cost, ability to fax and two sided printing makes this a great home office printer. Really happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: A very good product
customer_reviews.text: This unit has performed as advertised, so far with out flaw. It takes some time & support to get all the options set up especially if you have voice mail on you phones. I must also add that I found the same product & mod. number at Sam's for $20 less.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless printer.
customer_reviews.text: Good printer/scanner, have used it for years, actually bought a second one. Probably more for low volume use.
customer_reviews.author: FISHER SPACE PEN Q-4

customer_reviews.title: Great Workhorse my WorkForce 645
customer_reviews.text: Nice machine. But haven't figured out how to do FAX's yet. The instructions are hard for me to follow.(i'm not much of a computer/periferal hardware-type person) Print quality is very good but we are forced to buy ink from after market companies instead of Epson in order to keep ink costs down so we can make copies at a competitive level.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love this more than my HP series
customer_reviews.text: I love this more than my HP series, and the HP cost more money. This works just as good and is not as big as the HP, and the ink cost less money.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Brice

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been GREAT. Pretty easy setup and we use it all the time with the wireless feature. Also, be sure to download the app, which allows you to print pdfs and other documents from the phone....very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer.
customer_reviews.text: I have found some cheap replacement ink on Amazon. And this printer is exactly what I wanted. Everything about it works great. Except when I try to scan from printer. It won't recognize any connected computers. But if I scan from computer it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: theMaDarmenian

customer_reviews.title: Epson-All-in-one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Epson WorkForce 645, at Amazon, and when it arrived I had it up and running within fifteen minutes. Never have I had a printer, let alone a wireless all-in-one, that was so easy to set up and have operational in minutes. The print quality is "top notch." The scan, copy and fax features work like a charm. This is the ONE machine for your print, copy, scan and fax needs. JVH
customer_reviews.author: John V. Hyer

customer_reviews.title: Could do better
customer_reviews.text: I bought it mainly for scanner, printing and copy... After 4 months of light use, I got a black ink warning, to be replaced and I think I'm under 500 pages. Also, the noise is pretty loud when printing, very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Just-eu

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for over a year now and it works great. Use it in spurts of heavy use but not everyday use. Am very happy with this purchase. Far better than HP, Canon, or Kodak that I had used in the past. Amazing this little printer shows them up. I recommend this printer for users who need the printer for occasional use to moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Big Hendrix Fan

customer_reviews.title: My daughters workhorse printer/scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter when she went to college and she loves it. She's in architecture and interior design - so quality of output is critical. Scans great, prints great. A set of cartridges last her a whole school year.
customer_reviews.author: Toddd L. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Great WiFi printer. Very easy to setup and use. Have not had any problems with printer since i've bought it and have setup multiple computer on it. Print quality is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: CS Wang

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Good price and it does easily everything i ask of it. I don't use it that much as i have a laser printer for most of what i do and i now use an internet fax but images are good speed is good and i use it to scan things and i live the feeder on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Tod a Burros

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, prints from iPad and iPhone too
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this since it supports airprint for all our apple stuff but it really does a great job of printing and stays connected via the network, which not all network printers do for some reason. Goes through ink pretty quick though.
customer_reviews.author: JPT

customer_reviews.title: Great for home office
customer_reviews.text: Great for home office. Fairly fast copying, good quality print, have had some problem with wireless connectivity, but overall well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Padmo

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace a laser printer that was costing me over $300 each time I needed to replace toner cartridges. This printer has been a perfect replacement. Installation was simple, and not only can I print to it from any computers in the house, but also from all of our iPads and iPhones. The duplex printing feature allows me to save tons of paper and produce great looking 8.5 X 5.5 booklets for meeting handouts. Overall, I am very pleased with this printer
customer_reviews.author: Mainely Tim

customer_reviews.title: Printer works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Epson 645 to replace my dead HP Photosmart. As expected, the Epson was easy to install and use, but does not do photos as well as the HP. Also, could not get our Macbook Air to print over the LAN, but it prints fine via USB. All other PCs print fine over my LAN. I noticed that other reviews had similar problems with MACs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tech buys I've ever done. Great value. Works like new to this day. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Reignman

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce 645 Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Copier, Scanner, Fax, iOS/Tablet/Smartphone/AirPrint Compatible (C11CB86201)
product_meta.description:
Engineered for Business. Ideal for the busy home office, the Workforce 645 is the hassle-free all-in-one that brings you the World's Fastest one- and two-sided print speeds in its class, plus automatic two-sided printing/copying/scanning. It boasts a 250-sheet paper tray, and you can save on ink with available Extra High-capacity ink cartridges - up to 40% less printing costs than color lasers. You can even save time with the Workforce 645 with speeds of 15 ISO ppm (black) and 7.2 ISO ppm (color). Use the 30-page ADF to quickly copy, scan or fax stacks of two-sided originals. Easily share your all-in-one with built-in wired and wireless networking. Or, use Epson Connect to print from popular mobile devices. This powerful product is built to keep your business running at full speed.Compatible Operating Systems: Windows: Windows 7, Vista, XP, XP x64,Mac: OS X 10.4.11, 10.5.8, 10.6.x, 10.7.x.Rated Voltage 100 to 120 VAC.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



WORKFORCE 645 ALL-IN-ONE
PRINT | COPY | SCAN | FAX | WI-FI



FUNCTIONS



SPEED AND IMAGE QUALITY



AFFORDABILITY






RELIABILITY



WHAT IS ISO PPM?
ISO ppm is based on the international standard for measuring print speed. Black and color print speeds are determined in default, single-side mode, in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Actual print times will vary based on system configuration, software, and page complexity.

See www.epson.com/printspeed for details, including complete ISO reports.









ECO FEATURES







*Yields based on ISO/IEC 24711 tests in default mode printing continuously. Actual yields will be lower with higher-density images, hot or dusty conditions, less frequent printing or printing predominantly with one color. All ink colors are used for printing and all-in-one maintenance, and all colors have to be installed for printing. For print quality, part of the ink from the included cartridges is used for printer startup and a variable amount of ink remains in the cartridges after the "replace cartridge" signal. For details, see www.epson.com/cartridgeinfo 
 1.  Fastest in its class; printing black text in default, single-sided mode, in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Compared to ink jet all-in-ones priced at $199 or less, as of March 2011, based on manufacturers’ rated ISO speeds or independent testing.
 2.  Compared with best-selling color laser all-in-ones priced at $499 or less, as of December 2010. Calculation based on continuous printing with highest-capacity cartridges. Actual savings will vary based on print task and use conditions.
 3.  Get about two times more prints per cartridge compared with Epson’s 126 Black ink cartridge.
 4.  See www.epson.com/connect regarding compatible devices and apps.
 5.  Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n certified; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Visit www.wi-fi.org/files/11nbasics_glossary.pdf for more information.
 6.  Epson provides phone support without charge for the life of the product. Telephone toll charges may apply.
 7.  Actual savings and yields may vary.
 8.  Some applications and/or functions, like two-sided printing, may not be supported under Mac OS X.
 9.  Compared to the best-selling monochrome and color multifunction laser printers available for $699 or less as of December 2010. Actual power savings will vary by product model and usage.
 10. See our website for convenient and reasonable recycling options at www.epson.com/recycle
 11. For sending faxes only
 12. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.
 13. Up to 40% lower printing costs compared with best-selling color laser all-in-ones priced at $499 or less, as of December 2010. Calculation based on continuous printing with highest-capacity cartridges. Actual savings will vary based on print task and use conditions.

Epson, DURABrite and WorkForce are registered trademarks, Epson Exceed Your Vision is a registered logomark and Better Products for a Better Future is a trademark of Seiko Epson Corporation. Apple is a trademark of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries. iPad is a trademark of Apple Inc. SmartWay is a service mark of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Wi-Fi is a registered mark of the Wi-Fi Alliance. All other product and brand names are trademarks and/or registered trademarks of their respective companies. Epson disclaims any and all rights in these marks. Copyright 2011 Epson America, Inc. 8/11
feature_bullets: 15 ISO ppm black, 7.2 ISO ppm color

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars501 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
